result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Richard Lee Kuykendall appeared by phone.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant is currently not working and is under a doctor's care. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests a signature bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond with a condition to contact SPD. Bonds will be mailed. Court withdraws warrant. Arraignment date set.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard Lee Kuykendall not in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Glenn Edward Avena in court for Richard Lee Kuykendall. Court heard on defendant's failure to appear. State requests warrant. Attorney Avena objects without argument. Court authorizes warrant. Attorney Avena requests to withdraw. Court advises counsel to file motion to withdraw.
